original: de rnams kyi de bzhin nyid ni mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba yin la de bzhin nyid de yang nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi de bzhin nyid ni mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba yin la de bzhin nyid de yang nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The suchness of those is realized, and that suchness is like space.

original: gzhol ba dang 'bab pa dang phyogs pa zhes bya ba chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbang gis tshig rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: gzhol ba dang 'bab pa dang phyogs pa zhes bya ba chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbang gis tshig rnam pa gsum mo //

analyzed: de ni bye brag tu brtags pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i lhag ma'o //
translated: That is called the investigation of the particulars is a supplement to the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni de'i nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni de'i nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: Why is that? is the question about its similarity to space.

original: gzhal du med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan no //
analyzed: gzhal du med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan no //
translated: The answer is incalculable, etc.

original: yul dang dus la gzhal bar bya mi nus pa'i phyir gzhal du med pa'o //
analyzed: yul dang dus la gzhal bar bya mi nus pa'i phyir gzhal du med pa'o //
translated: It is incalculable because it cannot be measured in terms of place and time.

original: de bzhin nyid ni tshad ma dang bral ba'i phyir tshad ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni tshad ma dang bral ba'i phyir tshad ma med pa'o //
translated: It is unmeasurable because suchness is free from a valid cognition.

original: de ni gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba nas ji srid gang du yang mi gnas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba nas ji srid gang du yang mi gnas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not form, etc., up to it does not stand anywhere.

original: 'di rnams thams cad yul dang dus la mi khyab pa nyid kyis tshad ma dang ldan pa'i phyir gzhal du med pa la de'i ngo bo dang sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams thams cad yul dang dus la mi khyab pa nyid kyis tshad ma dang ldan pa'i phyir gzhal du med pa la de'i ngo bo dang sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: All of these are unmeasurable because they are not pervaded by place and time, and because they are connected with a valid cognition. Incalculable is connected with its nature.

original: de la thob pa ni rtogs pa'i skad cig ma dang po la rung pa nyid so sor rtogs pa'i ngo bo rtogs par bya ba'i chos thams cad kyi mngon par rtogs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid rnams la'o //
analyzed: de la thob pa ni rtogs pa'i skad cig ma dang po la rung pa nyid so sor rtogs pa'i ngo bo rtogs par bya ba'i chos thams cad kyi mngon par rtogs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid rnams la'o //
translated: Attainment is the realization of the nature of the realization of the first moment of realization, the realization of all phenomena that are to be realized, with regard to their individual characteristics.

original: khong du chud pa ni chos gang yang rung ba mngon du bya ba'o //
analyzed: khong du chud pa ni chos gang yang rung ba mngon du bya ba'o //
translated: Understanding is the realization of any phenomenon whatsoever.

original: lam ni mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lam ni mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa'o //

original: lam gyi 'bras bu ni des bsgrub par bya ba nyon mongs pa spong ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyi 'bras bu ni des bsgrub par bya ba nyon mongs pa spong ba la sogs pa'o //

original: ye shes ni spyi'i ngo bo yongs su gcod pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni spyi'i ngo bo yongs su gcod pa'o //

original: rnam par shes pa ni khyad par gyi ngo bo yongs su gcod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni khyad par gyi ngo bo yongs su gcod pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is the ascertainment of the specific nature.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dag ni ji ltar 'jig rten las nges pa skad cig ma yin pa'i phyogs la ni skye ba dang 'jig pa dang rgyu gzhan gyis byas pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dag ni ji ltar 'jig rten las nges pa skad cig ma yin pa'i phyogs la ni skye ba dang 'jig pa dang rgyu gzhan gyis byas pa'o //
translated: Arising and destruction are made by other causes in the context of the momentary disintegration of the world.

original: skad cig ma'i phyogs la ni rang gi rgyud tsam las skyes pa'i 'gag pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i phyogs la ni rang gi rgyud tsam las skyes pa'i 'gag pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'o //
translated: In the case of momentariness, cessation is the abandonment of all afflictions that arises from the mere continuum of itself.

original: sgom pa ni yang dang yang du sems la nges par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sgom pa ni yang dang yang du sems la nges par zhugs pa'o //
translated: Cultivation is the repeated entry of the mind into ascertainment.

original: sgom pa dang bral ba ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pas 'bad pa'i khyad par can gyi sgom pa'o //
analyzed: sgom pa dang bral ba ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pas 'bad pa'i khyad par can gyi sgom pa'o //

original: phyogs ni yul gyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: phyogs ni yul gyi khyad par ro //

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni de zhes 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni de zhes 'jug pa yin no //

original: sus kyang zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis te de rnams kyi tshad ma nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sus kyang zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis te de rnams kyi tshad ma nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By no one means by the intrinsic reality of form, etc., because they possess the validity of those.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this:

original: gal te thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bya ba rnam @205a * //
analyzed: gal te thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bya ba rnam @205a * //
translated: If omniscience were an action, it would be produced by causes and conditions.

original: par 'gyur ba bong ba dang gnas pa dang ldan pa phyogs gcig pa gzhal par bya ba ni brtags pa'i rnam par 'gyur na de ltar yod pa na gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par 'gyur ba bong ba dang gnas pa dang ldan pa phyogs gcig pa gzhal par bya ba ni brtags pa'i rnam par 'gyur na de ltar yod pa na gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The imagined transformation of the form, etc., is the measure of the one-sided, partial reality. But when it exists in that way, one does not fully awaken to reality through the dharmas of form, etc.

original: gang gi phyir de'i rnam pa dang bral ba nam mkha'i chos can de bas na de gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyis mngon par rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i rnam pa dang bral ba nam mkha'i chos can de bas na de gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyis mngon par rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Because it is devoid of that aspect, it is a dharma of space. Therefore, one does not fully awaken to form, etc.

original: de rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not exist.

original: de bzhin nyid ni de rnams kyi tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo mngon par rtogs pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni de rnams kyi tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo mngon par rtogs pa yin zhes bya ba'o //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //

original: lan ni gzugs nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni gzugs nyid ces bya ba ste /

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i gzugs so //

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa'o //

original: kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa rnams la med pa nyid kyis de'i tshe nub pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i gzugs la sogs pa nam mkha' dang mnyam pa rnams la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa rnams la med pa nyid kyis de'i tshe nub pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i gzugs la sogs pa nam mkha' dang mnyam pa rnams la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: because of the non-existence of the imagined and the relative forms, etc., the latter are then obscured, and the forms, etc., of the perfected, which are equal to space, are the reality of omniscience.

original: de ltar zab pa'i chos thos pas lha rnams /
analyzed: de ltar zab pa'i chos thos pas lha rnams /
translated: Thus, the gods, having heard the Dharma which is so profound,üîΩpraise the Lord with the words, ‚ÄúProfound, O Lord, is the perfection of wisdom,‚Äù etc.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zab po zhes bya ba la sogs pas mngon par bsngags nas de bzhin gshegs pa la 'dod pa chung ba nyid kyis slar yang zab pa nyid ston par byed cing zhes gsungs pa ni //
translated: Then, in order to demonstrate profundity again by means of the absence of desire, the Lord says,üîΩ‚ÄúSo it is, Kausika,‚Äù etc.

analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste zab pa ni gnyis kyis kun tu spyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gting dpag dka' ba ni kun brtags dang gzhan dbang dag gis bsgribs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: blta bar dka' ba ni 'jig rten pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is difficult to see because it is not the domain of the worldly path of cultivation.

original: rtogs par dka' ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag la yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyis mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs par dka' ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag la yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyis mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: byed 'dod pa mi byed pa ni brtson pa chung ba'o //

analyzed: gzhol bar mdzad pa ni mgu bar byed pa'o //

analyzed: gang du sus kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di nyid la lhag pa'i bya ba dgag pa'o //

analyzed: nam mkha' zab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas las dgag pa'o //

analyzed: bdag zab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas byed pa po dgag pa'o //
translated: By ‚Äúbecause of the profundity of the self‚Äù and so on, he prohibits the superimposition of an agent.

analyzed: chos thams cad sgrib pa med pa nyid kyis zab pa zhes @205b bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe profundity of all phenomena due to the absence of obscurations‚Äù is stated by some.

analyzed: chos thams cad kyi thob par bya ba de rnams 'ong ba med pa nyid kyis zab pa'o //

original: ngo mtshar to zhes bya ba la ni sngar ma mthong ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo mtshar to zhes bya ba la ni sngar ma mthong ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Astonishing means that it is not seen before.

original: rmad du byung ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu la khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmad du byung ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu la khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Wonderful means that it is endowed with a special cause and effect.

original: mi mthun pa ni bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa ni bzlog pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is not astonishing and not wonderful.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: mi bzung ba'i slad du ste 'di ni gzugs so zhes mtshan mar byed pa ni 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: mi bzung ba'i slad du ste 'di ni gzugs so zhes mtshan mar byed pa ni 'dzin pa ste /
translated: In order not to grasp means that this is form is grasping.

original: de las gzhan ni mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan ni mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is not grasping.

original: brgya byin la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyis nye bar mtshon par byed pa'i le'u ni lha'i le'u ste le'u bcva lnga pa'o /
analyzed: brgya byin la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyis nye bar mtshon par byed pa'i le'u ni lha'i le'u ste le'u bcva lnga pa'o /
translated: The chapter that illustrates the gods such as Indra is the chapter on the gods, the fifteenth chapter.

original: // / da ni gnas brtan rab 'byor ji ltar mi 'dzin pa'i phyir chos ston par byed pa de ltar gsal bar mdzad pa ni chos thams cad dmigs su ma mchis pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: // / da ni gnas brtan rab 'byor ji ltar mi 'dzin pa'i phyir chos ston par byed pa de ltar gsal bar mdzad pa ni chos thams cad dmigs su ma mchis pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, in order to clarify how the elder Subhuti teaches the Dharma by not grasping, it is said that all dharmas are unapprehendable, etc.

original: gzung bar nus pa'i kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo'i mi dmigs pa ni stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: gzung bar nus pa'i kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo'i mi dmigs pa ni stong pa nyid de /

original: de'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos 'di yin la de bas na chos thams cad la de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid can gyi phyir mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan par byed pa ni /

translated: This is the reality which has that as its characteristic. Therefore, the teaching of the reality of non-apprehension is made in order to show that all things have the nature of thusness.

original: gang la yang thogs pa ma mchis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang la yang thogs pa ma mchis zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: gal te nye bar dmigs pa'i ngo bor 'gyur na de'i tshe chos rnams la phan tshun du mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir chos gcig gzhan du thogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were the reality of apprehension, then, since the characteristics of things are different from one another, one thing would be obstructed by another.

original: dper na sngon po ser po la'o //
analyzed: dper na sngon po ser po la'o //
translated: For example, blue is obstructed by yellow.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid la thams cad du yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir gang du yang thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid la thams cad du yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir gang du yang thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: But, since the characteristic of emptiness is everywhere the same, it is not obstructed anywhere.

original: 'dis ni chos rnams thams cad la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' med par gsungs pas so //
analyzed: 'dis ni chos rnams thams cad la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' med par gsungs pas so //
translated: This is because it is said that all things are free from the extremes of superimposition and negation.

original: kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo med pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' med pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo med pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' med pa'o //

analyzed: chos nyid kyi ngo bo la skur pa mi 'debs pa'i phyir skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' med pa'o //

analyzed: thams cad du gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis khas blangs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //

original: 'thad pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'thad pa gsungs pa ni /

analyzed: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because it is similar to space.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' thams cad la rjes su 'gro ba gang du yang @206a * //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' thams cad la rjes su 'gro ba gang du yang @206a * //
translated: Just as space is omnipresent and unobstructed anywhere,

original: thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: so too is the reality of mind.

original: ci'i phyir mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa ni /

original: lam thams cad mi dmigs pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lam thams cad mi dmigs pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ste /

original: lam ni sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'des pa dag la rab tu gnas par gyur pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo can gzugs la sogs pa dang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa rnams te /

translated: The path is the extreme of superimposition and the extreme of denial, which are the entities of existence and nonexistence, such as form and so on and the horns of a rabbit and so on.

original: de rnams kyi mi dmigs pa las so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mi dmigs pa las so //

original: gal te dngos po'i ngo bor 'gyur ba yin na gcig gzhan du thogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i ngo bor 'gyur ba yin na gcig gzhan du thogs par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo la yang ci'i phyir gzhan du rjes su 'gro ba'i nus pa'o //
translated: And if it were the entity of a nonexistent, why would it not be obstructed by another?

original: gnyi ga'i ngo bo dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa nyid ni gang du yang thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i ngo bo dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa nyid ni gang du yang thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: Since it is free from the entity of both, emptiness is not obstructed anywhere.

original: thogs pa ma mchis pa'i mtshan nyid ni mtshungs pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: thogs pa ma mchis pa'i mtshan nyid ni mtshungs pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //

analyzed: de med pas na do zla ma mchis pa'i mtshan nyid do // mngon par grub pa ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni /

original: 'gal ba can dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba can dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: means because of being free from contradiction.

original: gnas ni rab tu gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gnas ni rab tu gnas pa ste /

analyzed: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang mya ngan las 'das pa rnams so //

original: de @209b dag rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid /üîΩces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de @209b dag rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid / ces bya ba'o //
translated: They are the particular and universal characteristics.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni rtog ge'i bstan bcos la'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni rtog ge'i bstan bcos la'o //
translated: Here means in the treatise on logic.

original: tha snyad pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid 'dir brjod ces bya ba'i rigs pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid 'dir brjod ces bya ba'i rigs pa'o //
translated: It is reasonable to say that the characteristic of conventional valid cognition is stated here.

original: lung las ni zlog pa ste /üîΩrang gi mtshan nyid ni kun rdzob tu yod pa ste /
analyzed: lung las ni zlog pa ste / rang gi mtshan nyid ni kun rdzob tu yod pa ste /
translated: With regard to scripture, it is the opposite.üîΩThe particular characteristic exists conventionally.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni don dam par yod pa zhes bya ba'i dgongs pas so //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni don dam par yod pa zhes bya ba'i dgongs pas so //
translated: The universal characteristic exists ultimately. This is the intention.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'grel ba mkhan pos rtog ge'i bstan bcos 'di la de ltar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'grel ba mkhan pos rtog ge'i bstan bcos 'di la de ltar bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the author of the commentary explains it in this way.

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas kyang gsungs pa /üîΩthub dbang bstan pa las ni shin tu ring 'dod de //
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas kyang gsungs pa / thub dbang bstan pa las ni shin tu ring 'dod de //
translated: ƒÄcƒÅrya DignƒÅga also says:

original: gang zhig rtog ge'i lam gyis chos nyid khrid par 'dod //üîΩces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rtog ge'i lam gyis chos nyid khrid par 'dod // ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe one who wishes to lead reality by the path of logicüîΩis very far from the teaching of the Lord of Sages.‚Äù

original: de bzhin nyid de 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ci zhig tha dad pa yin nam 'on te ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ci zhig tha dad pa yin nam 'on te ma yin /
translated: Is suchness different or not from the perfection of wisdom?

original: 'di lta ste chos thams cad kyi rnag bzhin rnam par ma dag pa'i sems can gyi gnas skabs la yang yod de /üîΩde bzhin nyid de nyid ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga ;
analyzed: 'di lta ste chos thams cad kyi rnag bzhin rnam par ma dag pa'i sems can gyi gnas skabs la yang yod de / de bzhin nyid de nyid ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga ;
translated: It is like this: the nature of all phenomena exists even in the impure state of sentient beings.üîΩThat suchness itself, when realized on the very pure stage of the bodhisattva,

original: ba la gang gi tshe rtogs par 'gyur ba de nas bzung nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ba la gang gi tshe rtogs par 'gyur ba de nas bzung nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: from that point onward is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: shin tu dag pa'i gnas skabs la de nyid ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: shin tu dag pa'i gnas skabs la de nyid ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku'o //
translated: That very [suchness] is the dharma body of the Buddhas in the extremely pure stage.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa la ci zhig rjes su song ba yin nam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa la ci zhig rjes su song ba yin nam /
translated: What is it that has gone to the attainment of arhatship?üîΩOr what is it that has gone to the very beginning?

original: 'on te ci zhig snga ma nyid du zhes bya ba dogs nas gnas brtan rab 'byor rang nyid kyis gsungs pa ni dang po nyid nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'on te ci zhig snga ma nyid du zhes bya ba dogs nas gnas brtan rab 'byor rang nyid kyis gsungs pa ni dang po nyid nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Fearing such doubts, the elder Subh≈´ti himself states, From the very beginning, and so on.

original: de zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la rjes su song ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la rjes su song ba'o //
translated: That refers to having gone to suchness.

original: ci'i phyir zhes dogs nas /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes dogs nas /
translated: Fearing the question, Why?

original: gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / chos thams cad kyi de zhin nyid dang / rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid la gcig pa nyid du rjes su song ba nyid rab tu bsgrub pa'i don du bstan par byed pa ni 'on te /
analyzed: gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / chos thams cad kyi de zhin nyid dang / rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid la gcig pa nyid du rjes su song ba nyid rab tu bsgrub pa'i don du bstan par byed pa ni 'on te /
translated: He states, That which is the suchness of the TathƒÅgata, the suchness of all phenomena, and the suchness of Subh≈´ti, are the same suchness, in order to establish the meaning of having gone to the sameness of those.

original: gal te de bzhin nyid ces bya ba gang yang stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yod na /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin nyid ces bya ba gang yang stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yod na /
translated: If there were any such thing called suchness with the nature of emptiness,

original: de ltar na de bzhin nyid ma yin pas kyang stong pa nyid ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis yod par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar na de bzhin nyid ma yin pas kyang stong pa nyid ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis yod par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Thus, since it is not suchness, it would exist by way of an entity that is not emptiness.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs med par gnyen por 'thad par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs med par gnyen por 'thad par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: The antidote would not be tenable without its counter-correlate.

original: des kyang chos thams cad mi stong par yang 'gyur ro zhes gsungs @210a * //üîΩpa ni de bzhin yang de bzhin nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: des kyang chos thams cad mi stong par yang 'gyur ro zhes gsungs @210a * // pa ni de bzhin yang de bzhin nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba la //
translated: And by that, all phenomena would not be empty.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning of ‚ÄúIt is not suchness, nor is it not suchness‚Äù is as follows.

original: de bzhin nyid ni don dam pa ste don dam pa yang yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i spros pa thams cad kyis stong pa zhes de'i phyir de bzhin nyid ces bya ba'i cung zad dngos po gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni don dam pa ste don dam pa yang yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i spros pa thams cad kyis stong pa zhes de'i phyir de bzhin nyid ces bya ba'i cung zad dngos po gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The ultimate is suchness, and the ultimate is empty of all elaborations, such as existence and nonexistence. Therefore, there is not even the slightest other thing that is called ‚Äúsuchness.‚Äù

original: de bas na de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin nyid ma yin zhes ba ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin nyid ma yin zhes ba ba'o //
translated: Therefore, suchness is not suchness.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: stong nyid lta ba thams cad kyi //
analyzed: stong nyid lta ba thams cad kyi //
translated: The view of emptiness

original: nges par 'byung ba rgyal bas gsungs //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba rgyal bas gsungs //
translated: the Victorious One has taught the means of attaining liberation.

original: gang gi stong nyid lta ba ste //üîΩde rnams bsgrub bya ma yin smra //
analyzed: gang gi stong nyid lta ba ste // de rnams bsgrub bya ma yin smra //
translated: Those who view emptiness

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: are said to be incapable of being trained.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi gnas pa gang yin pa'i gnas pa des bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi gnas pa gang yin pa'i gnas pa des bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The abiding in suchness is the abiding in the three natures.

original: gnas pa nyid ni gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnas pa nyid ni gnas pa nyid do //
translated: Abiding itself is the abiding in the perfected nature.

original: chos kyi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid 'dis kyang tha mi dad pa gcig pa nyid ces ston par byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid 'dis kyang tha mi dad pa gcig pa nyid ces ston par byed do //
translated: This characteristic of the abiding of phenomena also teaches that they are not different, but one.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang gcig pa nyid ces gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang gcig pa nyid ces gsungs pa ni //
translated: It is also taught that they are one in another way:

original: 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is changeless, etc.

original: snga ma'i rang bzhin la rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir 'gyur ba med pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma'i rang bzhin la rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir 'gyur ba med pa'o //
translated: It is changeless because it is the same as the former nature.

original: rang bzhin gzhan mi skyed pa'i phyir rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan mi skyed pa'i phyir rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'o //
translated: It is not subject to change because it does not produce another nature.

original: 'dis ni mi 'gyur ba'i yongs su grub pa nyid bstan par byed de /
analyzed: 'dis ni mi 'gyur ba'i yongs su grub pa nyid bstan par byed de /
translated: This teaches the changelessness of the perfected nature.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: It is nonconceptual because it is not the nature of conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: It is non-conceptual because it is not the object of conceptualization.

original: 'dis ni phyin ci ma log pa'i yongs su grub pas yongs su grub pa zhes ston par byed de /
analyzed: 'dis ni phyin ci ma log pa'i yongs su grub pas yongs su grub pa zhes ston par byed de /
translated: This shows the perfected nature as the absence of error.

original: gcig nyid la gtan tshigs gzhan gsungs pa ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gcig nyid la gtan tshigs gzhan gsungs pa ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The other reason for the same point is stated in the line: ‚Äúbecause it is the same in all places.‚Äù

original: de gang la yang thogs pa med pa ni thams cad du song ba'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ni gcig ste zhes bya ba ni rigs mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir yang 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni gnyis su med cing zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de gang la yang thogs pa med pa ni thams cad du song ba'i phyir ro // 'di ni gcig ste zhes bya ba ni rigs mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir yang 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni gnyis su med cing zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is unobstructed in any place because it extends everywhere.üîΩThis is the one, the line ‚Äúit is the one‚Äù means that it is the same in kind.

original: rang bzhin las gcig pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin las gcig pa'o //
translated: It is also said to be nondual, the line ‚Äúit is nondual‚Äù means that it is the same in nature.

original: gnyis su byar med ces bya ba ni tha dad par bya ba'am gnyis su byar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su byar med ces bya ba ni tha dad par bya ba'am gnyis su byar mi nus pa'o //
translated: It is indivisible, the line ‚Äúit is indivisible‚Äù means that it cannot be divided into two.

original: de bas na gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: de bas na gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin nyid de /
translated: Therefore, it is the suchness of nonduality.

original: gnyis su med pa'i tha dad pa'i rnam pa thams cad med pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i tha dad pa'i rnam pa thams cad med pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid kyang yin no //
translated: It is suchness because it is the absence of all aspects of duality and difference.

original: ji ltar yang de ltar zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar yang de ltar zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: The phrase in whatever way is a reference to the passage that states:

original: gang gi yang de bzhin nyid ma yin @210b zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi yang de bzhin nyid ma yin @210b zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: It is not the reality of anything.

original: gang gi phyir yang zhes bya ba ni so sor nges pa'i 'brel pa can gyi'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang zhes bya ba ni so sor nges pa'i 'brel pa can gyi'o //
translated: The phrase for any reason whatsoever is a reference to the passage that states: ...because of the connection with a particular object.

original: de bzhin nyid de zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: The phrase that reality is a reference to the passage that states: ...it is not the case that it is not reality.

original: 'on kyang thams cad nyid kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad nyid kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase of everything is a reference to the passage that states: ...it is the reality of everything.

original: de ltar ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: In what way is it the reality of everything?

original: gang gi yang de bzhin nyid ma yin zhes bya ba ni chos rnams thams cad nyid la de de bzhin nyid de gcig la 'ga' zhig tu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi yang de bzhin nyid ma yin zhes bya ba ni chos rnams thams cad nyid la de de bzhin nyid de gcig la 'ga' zhig tu ni ma yin no //
translated: The phrase It is not the reality of anything is a reference to the passage that states: It is the reality of all entities, not just of some.

original: 'di yang ci'i phyir zhes gsungs pa ni /üîΩgang las kyang de bzhin nyid la yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di yang ci'i phyir zhes gsungs pa ni / gang las kyang de bzhin nyid la yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Why is it the reality of all entities?

original: de ni gang las kyang so sor nges pa'i yul nas sam dus las so //
analyzed: de ni gang las kyang so sor nges pa'i yul nas sam dus las so //
translated: The phrase for any reason whatsoever is a reference to the passage that states: ...because of the connection with a particular object.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid rtogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid rtogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: The phrase it is not the case that it is not reality is a reference to the passage that states: ...it is not the case that it is not reality.üîΩ The phrase it is not the case that it is not reality is a reference to the passage that states: ...it is the reality of everything.

original: 'on kyang yul dang dus thams cad las de de bzhin nyid du de bas na 'ga' zhig tu so sor nges pa'i 'brel ba can gyi de bzhin nyid de ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang yul dang dus thams cad las de de bzhin nyid du de bas na 'ga' zhig tu so sor nges pa'i 'brel ba can gyi de bzhin nyid de ma yin no //
translated: However, it is not that suchness is related to some particular thing in all places and times.

original: 'on kyang thams cad kyi'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad kyi'o //
translated: Rather, it is the suchness of all.

original: gang gi phyir de de bzhin nyid de gang gi yang ma yin pa de bas na de gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de de bzhin nyid de gang gi yang ma yin pa de bas na de gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Since suchness is not anything at all, it is called nondual.

original: snga ma nyid nye bar ston par byed pa de rjes su song ba nyid gtso bo nye bar sdud par byed pa ni de ltar na zhes bya ba sogs pas so //
analyzed: snga ma nyid nye bar ston par byed pa de rjes su song ba nyid gtso bo nye bar sdud par byed pa ni de ltar na zhes bya ba sogs pas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin this way‚Äù indicates that suchness is the principal object of the knowledge of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: ma byas pa'i de nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ma byas pa'i de nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: It is called ‚Äúthe suchness of the uncreated.‚Äù

original: ma byas pa yang yin la rtag pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid kyang yin te des de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su song ba'o //
analyzed: ma byas pa yang yin la rtag pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid kyang yin te des de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su song ba'o //
translated: It is uncreated because it is permanent. It is suchness because it is the suchness of all things. It is the suchness that is the object of the knowledge of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis rjes su song ba nyid gnas brtan la nye bar bstan nas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la rjes su song ba zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis rjes su song ba nyid gnas brtan la nye bar bstan nas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la rjes su song ba zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
translated: Having thus taught the Elder's conformity with the tathatƒÅ of the TathƒÅgata, in order to teach his conformity with the TathƒÅgata himself, it is said:

original: ma byas pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ma byas pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The suchness of the unfabricated...

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin nyid ni gnyis su med pa de bas na gnas brtan de bzhin gshegs pa nyid las su gyur pa la rjes su song pa de bzhin gshegs pa dang yang lhan cig tu bdag nyid gcig pa rjes su song ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin nyid ni gnyis su med pa de bas na gnas brtan de bzhin gshegs pa nyid las su gyur pa la rjes su song pa de bzhin gshegs pa dang yang lhan cig tu bdag nyid gcig pa rjes su song ba'o //
translated: Since suchness is non-dual, therefore the Elder's conformity with the TathƒÅgata himself is his conformity with the TathƒÅgata's identity.

original: 'on te de bzhin gshegs pa dang / gnas brtan rab 'byor dag la de bzhin nyid gcig pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la rjes su song ba gnas brtan yod mod de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la ni ji ltar rjes su song ba de bzhin gshegs pa dang /üîΩgnas @211a * //
analyzed: 'on te de bzhin gshegs pa dang / gnas brtan rab 'byor dag la de bzhin nyid gcig pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la rjes su song ba gnas brtan yod mod de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la ni ji ltar rjes su song ba de bzhin gshegs pa dang / gnas @211a * //
translated: But how has the elder Subhuti gone to the Tathagata in the same way that the Tathagata has gone to suchness?

original: brtan dag la tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir zhes dogs nas de bzhin nyid ltar gnyi ga de bzhin gshegs pa dang gnas brtan dag la yang de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir tha dad pa med ces ston par byed pa ni ji ltar de bzhin
analyzed: brtan dag la tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir zhes dogs nas de bzhin nyid ltar gnyi ga de bzhin gshegs pa dang gnas brtan dag la yang de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir tha dad pa med ces ston par byed pa ni ji ltar de bzhin
translated: In order to dispel this doubt, he shows that just as suchness is the same in both the Tathagata and the elder Subhuti, so they are the same in the nature of suchness:

original: gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: As the suchness of the Tathagata, etc.

original: rnam pa thams cad du yul dang dus la sogs pa la mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du yul dang dus la sogs pa la mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: In all ways, he is not imagined and does not imagine objects, time, etc., as before.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid las de bzhin gshegs pa de nyid kyis rab 'byor yang sprul pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid las de bzhin gshegs pa de nyid kyis rab 'byor yang sprul pa'o //
translated: Similarly, means that the Tathagata is an emanation from emptiness itself, because of the nature of non-conceptuality and non-discrimination.

original: stong nyid ngo bo yin pa ste //
analyzed: stong nyid ngo bo yin pa ste //
translated: The essence of emptiness

original: bag chags kyis ni bsgos gyur pa //
analyzed: bag chags kyis ni bsgos gyur pa //
translated: is moistened by the latent tendencies

original: rlung gis bskor bas brtan gyur te //
analyzed: rlung gis bskor bas brtan gyur te //
translated: and becomes stable through being turned by the wind.

original: chos nyid ji ltar rdo ba can //
analyzed: chos nyid ji ltar rdo ba can //
translated: How is reality like a stone?

original: zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: 'di gnyi ga yang bskal pa ma yin zhing tha mi dad pa ste zhes bya ba ni gnod byed kyis dor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga yang bskal pa ma yin zhing tha mi dad pa ste zhes bya ba ni gnod byed kyis dor bar byed pa'o //
translated: Both of these are not different and not separate means that they are not discarded by the adversary.

original: tha dad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga dang de bzhin nyid kyis sprul pa la gang zhig tha dad par byed pa'i rgyu de mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: tha dad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga dang de bzhin nyid kyis sprul pa la gang zhig tha dad par byed pa'i rgyu de mi dmigs pas so //
translated: Because the cause of differentiation is not observed, means that in both and in suchness, the cause of differentiation in the emanation is not observed.

original: nye bar sdud par byed pa ni de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar sdud par byed pa ni de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The summary is from Thus... and so on.

original: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid dang chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la gcig pa nyid kyi phyir gnas brtan de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su song ba zhes ston par byed de /
analyzed: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid dang chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la gcig pa nyid kyi phyir gnas brtan de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su song ba zhes ston par byed de /

analyzed: gang zhig kun du rab tu 'gul kun du rab tu g-yos zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs pa gang zhig 'gul ba la sogs pa rnams chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po spyir gcig pa nyid kyis brjod 'dod pas rnam par 'gyur ba drug ces brjod pa

analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i gnas brtan ni rjes su skyes pa ste gnyi ga la yang de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: de ltar khyad par med pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la yongs su grub pa'i gnas brtan rjes su skyes pa zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: 'di ni spyod pa zab mo zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid ni ji ltar spyod pa ste /

analyzed: de tsam la gnas pa la yang kun rdzob la yang brten nas sgyu ma lta bu'i sbyin pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ji ltar zab pa'o //

original: kun brtags dang rnam par brtags pa'i chos rnams thams @213a * //
analyzed: kun brtags dang rnam par brtags pa'i chos rnams thams @213a * //

original: cad yongs su bsgyur ba rnams la gang zhig 'di de'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i chos rtogs par 'gyur ba de dus thams cad la gnas kyang 'jig rten pa dang rtog ge ba rnams kyis rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin pa
analyzed: cad yongs su bsgyur ba rnams la gang zhig 'di de'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i chos rtogs par 'gyur ba de dus thams cad la gnas kyang 'jig rten pa dang rtog ge ba rnams kyis rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin pa
translated: That which is free from their characteristics, which is not to be expressed, and which is realized as the Dharma, even though it abides at all times, is not realized by mundane beings or logicians.

original: de'i phyir zab pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zab pa'o //

original: 'og tu chos mngon par rtogs pa ni go sla'o //

translated: Therein, the term ‚Äúholy being‚Äù is used because he does not engage in any activity that would harm others, even in the slightest way.

original: skyes bu chen po zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar byed pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar byed pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúgreat being‚Äù is used because he engages in the activity of bringing about the welfare and benefit of all sentient beings.

original: skyes bu mchog ces bya ba ni de nyid la brtson 'grus chen po byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu mchog ces bya ba ni de nyid la brtson 'grus chen po byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúsupreme being‚Äù is used because he is intent upon that very activity with great effort.

original: skyes bu mchog rab ces bya ba ni de nyid la mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par sdang ba la sogs pa la rnam par rgyal ba la mngon par brtson pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu mchog rab ces bya ba ni de nyid la mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par sdang ba la sogs pa la rnam par rgyal ba la mngon par brtson pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúexcellent being‚Äù is used because he is intent upon conquering the opposing side, such as hatred, etc., in relation to that very activity.

original: skyes bu khyu mchog ces bya ba ni dpag bsam gyi shing bzhin du 'gro ba rnams la nye bar 'tsho bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu khyu mchog ces bya ba ni dpag bsam gyi shing bzhin du 'gro ba rnams la nye bar 'tsho bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúbull among men‚Äù is used because he is intent upon providing sustenance for all beings, like a wish-fulfilling tree.

original: yang na skyes bu khyu mchog ces bya ba ni byams pa la sogs pa bsgoms pas brlan pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na skyes bu khyu mchog ces bya ba ni byams pa la sogs pa bsgoms pas brlan pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, the term ‚Äúsupreme being‚Äù is used because their minds are moistened by the cultivation of loving-kindness, etc.

original: skyes bu rgya che ba zhes bya ba ni mtha' yas pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs la sogs pa sgrub pa la brtson pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: skyes bu rgya che ba zhes bya ba ni mtha' yas pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs la sogs pa sgrub pa la brtson pa rnams kyis so //
translated: The term ‚Äúmagnanimous being‚Äù is used because they are dedicated to the practice of the accumulation of infinite merit, etc.

original: skyes bu mdzes pa zhes bya ba ni dus ring por gzhan gyi don la go cha bgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu mdzes pa zhes bya ba ni dus ring por gzhan gyi don la go cha bgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúbeautiful being‚Äù is used because they are armored for a long time for the benefit of others.

original: skyes bu gtso bo zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba la phan pa dang bde ba'i spyod pa la 'jug pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu gtso bo zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba la phan pa dang bde ba'i spyod pa la 'jug pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúforemost being‚Äù is used because they are dedicated to the practice of benefiting and gladdening the world.

original: skyes bu skyes mchog ces bya ba ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs pa rnams kyis yang gzhan gyi don la 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu skyes mchog ces bya ba ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs pa rnams kyis yang gzhan gyi don la 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúexcellent being‚Äù is used because, even though they are aware of the various sufferings of samsara, they do not abandon samsara for the sake of others.

original: skyes bu padmo zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba la gnas kyang nyon mongs pa rnams kyis ma gos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu padmo zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba la gnas kyang nyon mongs pa rnams kyis ma gos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúlotus-like being‚Äù is used because, even though they remain in samsara, they are unstained by the afflictions.

original: skyes bu padma dkar po zhes bya ba ni shin tu dkar ba la spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu padma dkar po zhes bya ba ni shin tu dkar ba la spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The person called the white lotus is one who practices the extremely pure.

original: skyes bu cang shes zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis gdul ba'i phyir dang gzhan 'dul bar byed pa la mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu cang shes zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis gdul ba'i phyir dang gzhan 'dul bar byed pa la mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The person called the noble one is one who is self-tamed and skilled in taming others.

original: skyes bu glang po che zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang lhan cig g-yul ngo la de rnams kyis zil gyis mi gnon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu glang po che zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang lhan cig g-yul ngo la de rnams kyis zil gyis mi gnon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The person called the elephant is one who, in battle with the afflictions, is not overwhelmed by them.

original: skyes bu seng ge zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa ma yin pa dang 'tsho ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu seng ge zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa ma yin pa dang 'tsho ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The person called the lion is one who is free from fear of unrhymed verse, of life and death, and so on.

original: skyes bu gdul bya'i kha lo sgyur ba zhes bya ba ni skal ba can rnams la mya ngan las 'das @223b pa'i grong khyer thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //

translated: The person called the charioteer of those to be tamed is one who causes the fortunate to attain the city of nirvana.

original: yang na bsngags pa'i tshig 'di rnams thams cad bsres pas shin tu che ba'i bsngags pa go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na bsngags pa'i tshig 'di rnams thams cad bsres pas shin tu che ba'i bsngags pa go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Or else, all these words of praise are mixed up, and so one understands the very great praise.

original: ci ltar khyed ni bdag gi mgon po dang khyed ni bdag gi rje bo dang khyed ni bdag gi mnga' bdag ces bya ba'i tshig rnams ni mnga' bdag nyid ni khyad par du byed de /
analyzed: ci ltar khyed ni bdag gi mgon po dang khyed ni bdag gi rje bo dang khyed ni bdag gi mnga' bdag ces bya ba'i tshig rnams ni mnga' bdag nyid ni khyad par du byed de /
translated: The words ‚Äúyou are my protector, you are my lord, you are my master‚Äù are words that make a distinction, since a master is one who has power.

original: 'dir yang skad cig ma bcu drug la ltos pas tshig rnams bcu drug ces bshad pa kha bskang ba'i don du tshig gsum po bsnan pa zhes smra'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang skad cig ma bcu drug la ltos pas tshig rnams bcu drug ces bshad pa kha bskang ba'i don du tshig gsum po bsnan pa zhes smra'o //
translated: Here, the three words are added for the sake of completing the explanation of the sixteen words, since they refer to the sixteen moments.

analyzed: po ti snga ma rnams la tshig bcu gsum kho na 'don pa yin no //

original: mjug bsdu bar byed pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mjug bsdu bar byed pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba ste /

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gzhan la gnod pa mi byed cing mchog gi bde ba la sems can thams cad nges par sbyar bar byed cing khyim na gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gzhan la gnod pa mi byed cing mchog gi bde ba la sems can thams cad nges par sbyar bar byed cing khyim na gnas pa yin no //

original: 'on te / le lo khyim na 'ongs pa min //
analyzed: 'on te / le lo khyim na 'ongs pa min //
translated: But if he is not lazy, he has come home.

original: mi smra bzhin yang brdzun pa yin //üîΩchad par nges par bskul ba yi //
analyzed: mi smra bzhin yang brdzun pa yin // chad par nges par bskul ba yi //

original: gzhan la mi byed pa yang min //
analyzed: gzhan la mi byed pa yang min //

analyzed: de bas na gzhan la gnod pa med par ji ltar khyim la gnas pa zhes gsungs pa ni /

original: 'di ltar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, it is said, ‚ÄúIf he sees a woman,‚Äù and so on.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis sgyu ma lta bu'i 'gro ba mthong zhing 'di la ci'i phyir khyim la gnas pa'i skyon zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis sgyu ma lta bu'i 'gro ba mthong zhing 'di la ci'i phyir khyim la gnas pa'i skyon zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: gnod sbyin chen po ni gnod sbyin gyi bdag po'o //

analyzed: de mthong bya ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar rtag tu phyi bzhin 'brang ba shes par bya zhe na gsungs pa ni /

original: skyes bu khyu mchog gi dbang po dang ldan par 'gyur zhes bya ba la skyes bu khu mchog rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
analyzed: skyes bu khyu mchog gi dbang po dang ldan par 'gyur zhes bya ba la skyes bu khu mchog rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /

translated: Just as the Blessed One himself, when asked by a father who knew astrology, predicted that a son would be born to him, and also said that he would be a human being who would experience the excellence of the gods.

analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pas so //

It is stated in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúMoreover‚Ä¶‚Äù and ending with ‚Äú‚Ä¶should be understood as irreversible from perfect enlightenment.‚ÄùüîΩThese are the sixteen signs of irreversibility.

original: de dag ni 'du 'dzi la dga' bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba dang // dam pa ma yin pa'i gtam la dga' ba ni mngon par chags pa 'di rnams la med ces bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: nam zhig sems can gyi don la ltos pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i 'gro ba 'dul bar byed pa'i thabs la mkhas pa rnams la skye ba yod pa dang dus de tsam du gnas pa'o //
translated: But when there is birth in the various realms, in order to benefit sentient beings, and when there is skill in means to train beings, then he remains for that long.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams la slar bdag nyid la sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa med pa'i phyir dang / sems can yongs su smin pa med pa'i phyir lha tshe ring po'i nang du skye ba ma blangs kyang smon lam gyi dbang gis skye bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams la slar bdag nyid la sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa med pa'i phyir dang / sems can yongs su smin pa med pa'i phyir lha tshe ring po'i nang du skye ba ma blangs kyang smon lam gyi dbang gis skye bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: In the formless realm, he does not take birth among the long lived gods, because there is no ripening of the qualities of a buddha for himself, and no ripening of sentient beings. But by the power of his vow, he is born there.

original: 'dren ma'i las kyi nus pas gal te skye ba yin na de'i tshe skyes pa de tsam nyid ni 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dren ma'i las kyi nus pas gal te skye ba yin na de'i tshe skyes pa de tsam nyid ni 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he is born by the power of the karma of the intermediate existence, then he dies and passes away just as he is born.

original: de nyid kyi phyir theg pa chen po'i chos mngon pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir theg pa chen po'i chos mngon pa las gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said in the Abhidharma of the Mahayana:

original: nyan thos kyi zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i sems can no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i sems can no //
translated: The sravaka is a sentient being of the three realms.

original: rang sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni khams gcig pa'i sems can te 'dod pa'i khams las skyes pa nyid la rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni khams gcig pa'i sems can te 'dod pa'i khams las skyes pa nyid la rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The pratyekabuddha is a sentient being of one realm, because he is born in the desire realm and attains pratyekabuddha enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni khams gnyis pa'i sems can no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni khams gnyis pa'i sems can no //

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams dag la sems can gyi don la ltos pas skye ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams dag la sems can gyi don la ltos pas skye ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is born in the desire realm and the form realm, in dependence on sentient beings.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gnas pa yod pa ma yin zhes @225a * //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gnas pa yod pa ma yin zhes @225a * //
translated: But bodhisattvas do not abide in the formless realm.

original: bya ba'o // yul gyi dbus zhes bya ba ni 'di thob par byed pa sems can 'dul ba la ltos pas dud 'gro rnams su skye ba yod pa'i phyir ro //

translated: The middle of the field is called the middle of the realm of sentient beings, because it is the basis for the attainment of the bodhisattva stages, and because it is the basis for the taming of sentient beings.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: rang gi sa la the tshom med pa zhes bya ba rtags bcu bdun pa gsungs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi sa la the tshom med pa zhes bya ba rtags bcu bdun pa gsungs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: the tshom nyid rnams ni che ba dang 'bring dang chung ba the tshom dang som nyi dang kun du zhum pa rnams so //
translated: The doubts are great, middling, and small doubts, hesitations, and uncertainties.

original: rang gi sa la zhes bya ba ni sa dang po thob pa nyid kyis phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi sa la zhes bya ba ni sa dang po thob pa nyid kyis phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: mtshams med pa'i sems de dang zhes bya ba ni mtshams med pa'i phyi nas gsungs pas so //

analyzed: sems de bsal ba ni rnam pa thams cad du gtong ba'o //

analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sems ni bdag nyid la phyir mi ldog pa nyid du nges pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe thought of non-regression‚Äù is the certainty of non-regression in oneself.

analyzed: ye shes kyis zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i ngo bos so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe thought of wisdom‚Äù is the thought of the nature of realization.

original: de bas na 'dir rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyis kyang bdud par chad bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyis kyang bdud par chad bya bar nus pa ma yin te /

analyzed: 'on te don dam par yod pa yang yin la rdzas kyang ma yin pa zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
